sentences.sContent: She’s still thinking about her next move.
sentences.sCn: 她还在考虑她的下一步行动。

sentences.sContent: Most of the council members are reluctant to make such a drastic move.
sentences.sCn: 大多数市政会成员不愿采取如此极端的举动。

sentences.sContent: The authorities have made no move to resolve the conflict.
sentences.sCn: 当局没有采取任何措施来解决冲突。

sentences.sContent: Taking the position was a good career move (= a decision that will improve the type of jobs you can do).
sentences.sCn: 接受这个职位在事业上是走对了一步。

sentences.sContent: ...9 billion cokes are purchased daily it's become so iconic that attempts to change its taste in 1985- sweetening it in a move projected to boost sales proved disastrous...
...to move their seeds to new localities...
...The Department of Health declared its intention to consider the move in November 2010 and consulted through 2012...
...made the decision to move from the countryside to the city...
...That's why it may be up to consumers to move the needle on chip and PIN...
...An earlier effort by Target to move to chip and PIN never gained progress...
...do predict if poor children will move up the economic ladder as adults...

phrases.pCn: 在活动中，在进行中；四处奔波
向前移动，提步向前；向前发展
使从…中醒悟过来；从…搬走，离开…
v. 走来走去；绕着……来回转
往里走；继续向前或后移动

words.tran: 动产的；可移动的；不固定的
原动力；鼓动者；搬运公司；搬家工人
移动，移动到；感动（move的过去式，过去分词）

trans.tranOther: something that you decide to do in order to achieve something
